meanings.definition: Having the most good fortune or success.
meanings.sent1: She felt like the luckiest person in the world when she won the raffle.
meanings.sent2: He considered himself the luckiest man alive after finding a four-leaf clover.
meanings.sent3: The luckiest cat in the neighborhood always caught the most mice.
meanings.sent4: The luckiest star in the sky shone the brightest.
meanings.sent5: Being the luckiest student in the class meant always acing exams effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Being in the most favorable circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Living in a peaceful town was the luckiest situation for her.
meanings.sent2: Finding a parking spot right in front of the store was the luckiest moment of the day.
meanings.sent3: The luckiest spot at the picnic table had the best view of the lake.
meanings.sent4: Being in the luckiest position on the team meant scoring the winning goal.
meanings.sent5: Wearing the luckiest socks always brought good fortune during exams.

meanings.definition: Receiving the most beneficial outcomes by chance.
meanings.sent1: Winning the lottery was the luckiest event of his life.
meanings.sent2: Getting a promotion without even applying was the luckiest break she ever had.
meanings.sent3: The luckiest bounce of the ball led to a game-winning goal.
meanings.sent4: Being in the luckiest seat on the rollercoaster meant the best view.
meanings.sent5: The luckiest guess in the game led to a surprising victory.
